data-science-projects.title: [DA] Youtube Analysis
data-science-projects.description: Conducting exploratory data analysis to provide a music agency with valuable insights into the factors influencing the likelihood of their music videos becoming trending on YouTube. Employed techniques for a comprehensive understanding.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Sleep State Prediction
data-science-projects.description: Conducted exploratory analysis, focusing on minute-based event labelling, identification of missing labels, and detection of duplicate data within series. Utilised logistic regression and random forest models for time series classification. Additionally, experimented with CNN/ResNet models for classification, evaluating their effectiveness in the given context.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Kickstarter
data-science-projects.description: Utilised Random Forest and XGBoost for predicting the number of backers needed for being successful in a Kickstarter campaign. The project progressed from extensive exploratory data analysis to predicting and hyperparameter tuning.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Health Insurance Costs
data-science-projects.description: Employed different regression models (Linear, Ridge, Lasso, Decision Tree, Random Forest, XGBoost, LightGBM, SVM) to predict the financial burden of insurance and identify important features responsible for these high costs. Explored the relationship between personal attributes, geographic factors, and their impact on medical insurance charges.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Stroke Prediction
data-science-projects.description: This project focuses on developing a machine learning model for predicting the likelihood of stroke events based on 11 clinical features. The dataset used for this analysis is the Stroke Prediction Dataset, which includes essential information to predict whether a patient is likely to experience a stroke.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Heart Attack Prediction
data-science-projects.description: Used various models (KNN, Logistic Regression, SVM, Decision Tree, Random Forest, XGBoost) to predict the most important feature that predicts heart attacks. Assessed accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-Score for each model.

data-science-projects.title: [DS] Diabetes Onset Prediction
data-science-projects.description: Utilised logistic regression and decision tree to predict the onset of diabetes in a dataset, including hyperparameter tuning. Evaluated model performance through accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-Score.

experimental-research-projects.title: Predicting Early Respiratory Infections and Childhood Asthma
experimental-research-projects.description: In our data-driven approach, we predicted respiratory infections and childhood asthma risk using statistical analyses and machine learning algorithms like K-Nearest Neighbours, Random Forest, and eXtreme Gradient Boosting. Feature importance was assessed using SHapley Additive exPlanations (SHAP) values, ensuring a robust predictive model.

experimental-research-projects.title: Nurturing Minds: Maternal Cells and Healthy Brain Development
experimental-research-projects.description: Exploring maternal cells' role in guiding healthy brain development, we utilized scRNA-sequencing data, Seurat clustering analysis, and differential gene expression analysis with MAST. RNA sequencing and bioinformatic analyses provided insights into molecular mechanisms, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of gene expression dynamics.

experimental-research-projects.title: Maternal Immune Support: Enhancing Offspring Defences
experimental-research-projects.description: Applying MeDIP-Seq to profile the epigenetics of hematopoietic stem cells (HSC), we identified Differentially Methylated Regions (DMRs) and conducted gene ontology analyses. For microbiome analysis, degenerate primers and QIIME were used. Statistical assessments, including Mann–Whitney-U tests and Spearman correlations, ensured robust data interpretation.

experimental-research-projects.title: Maternal Transfer of Pathogen-Specific T Cells Boosts Neonatal Immunity
experimental-research-projects.description: Evaluating the impact of maternal transfer of pathogen-specific T cells on neonatal immunity, we employed statistical analyses, robust regression, and outlier removal techniques. Various tests, including unpaired Students' t-Test, Mann–Whitney-U test, Ordinary one-way ANOVA, and Kruskal–Wallis test, ensured the reliability of results.

experimental-research-projects.title: Impact of the First COVID-19 Wave on Early Motherhood
experimental-research-projects.description: Assessing the influence of the initial COVID-19 wave on maternal mental health through a single-centre cross-sectional design, we employed various statistical methods, including one-way ANOVA, non-parametric tests, and multiple regression. Thorough statistical computations ensured a rigorous evaluation of psychological and sociodemographic variables.

experimental-research-projects.title: Impact of COVID-19 Conditions on Infants and Maternal Mental Health
experimental-research-projects.description: Our statistical analysis, incorporating descriptive statistics, univariate ANOVA, Mann–Whitney-U-Test, χ2-Test, and regression-based moderation analyses, provided a detailed exploration of the impact of COVID-19 conditions on both infants and maternal mental health. Addressing missing data, we used Expectation Maximization estimation.

experimental-research-projects.title: Prenatal Modulators and Cognitive Outcomes: A Comprehensive Review
experimental-research-projects.description: Examining observational studies, we synthesized evidence on how maternal distress and infections impact immune-endocrine adaptations during pregnancy. Delving into the intricacies of brain development in mice and humans, we introduced innovative perspectives on the correlation between altered adaptations and cognitive outcomes in offspring.
